newsitem.title: UK: Turkey ups five-year Eurobond to $400 million.
newsitem.headline: Turkey ups five-year Eurobond to $400 million.

text.p: Turkey has increased its recent five-year Eurobond to $400 million from $300 million, joint lead managers J.P. Morgan Securities and SBC Warburg said on Wednesday.
The new paper was reoffered at 100.046 for a 348 basis points spread over U.S. Treasuries.
The deal was originally launched on Monday.
TYPE STRAIGHT ISS PRICE 100.046 PAY DATE 23.MAY.97
MOODY B1 LISTING LUX PAY FREQ ANNUAL
NEG PLG YES CRS DEFLT YES FORCE MAJ YES
FULL FEES 1.00 HOME CTRY TURKEY TAX PROVS =
UNDERLYING GOVT BOND 6.625 PCT U.S. TREASURY NOTE DUE 30.APR.02
NOTES *INCREASE OF $300 MLN DEAL LAUNCHED AT 99.923/+350 BP
